STRUCTDEF.NAME: NFWL_LOG_CMD
STRUCTDEF.COMMENT: Commands to configure/enable/disable hw-fw Logging from NFCC

FIELDDEF.NAME: CtrlCmdType
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Flag to enable FW logging with default configuration

FIELDDEF.NAME: LogChIdPause
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Identifier of the log channel which shall be muted for further log generation

FIELDDEF.NAME: LogChIdResume
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Identifier of the log channel which shall be re-enabled for further log generation

FIELDDEF.NAME: LogPull
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Identifier of the log channel which shall be re-enabled for further log generation

FIELDDEF.NAME: loggingEn
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Enable FW logging with following configuration

FIELDDEF.NAME: usageModel
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Indicates log retrieval process: 0=> PULL, 1=> PUSH

FIELDDEF.NAME: logQHighWM
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Sets the watermark in FW queue : e.g. 1=> 1/4 of FW queue size 1=>

FIELDDEF.NAME: logQMode
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Sets the mode of log queue: e.g 1=>FREE_RUNNING/CIRCULAR, 2=> HALT_WHEN_FULL/LINEAR

FIELDDEF.NAME: limitlogLen
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Used to restrict the log frame size; must be power of two; used when configured for circular buffering

FIELDDEF.NAME: logTransporterId
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Dynamic function selector for transporting FW logged data to host

FIELDDEF.NAME: logMmSizeInKb
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: HW log queue size; shall always be a multiple of 4 and less than equal to 28

FIELDDEF.NAME: hlcMaskEvtId
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: HW logger event identifier to be disabled. HW logger is known to be stopped

FIELDDEF.NAME: hlcUnMaskEvtId
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: HW logger event identifier to be enabled. HW logger is known to be stopped

FIELDDEF.NAME: matchCtrlMode
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Used for CLF pattern based HW logging: 0=>any bit matched, 1=>all bits matched

FIELDDEF.NAME: matchMask0
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Bit selector for matchPat0 for comparison

FIELDDEF.NAME: matchMask1
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Bit selector for matchPat1 for comparison

FIELDDEF.NAME: matchMask2
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Bit selector for matchPat2 for comparison

FIELDDEF.NAME: matchMask3
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Bit selector for matchPat3 for comparison

FIELDDEF.NAME: startTrig
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Identifier of the HW log record which will trigger the Hw logging

FIELDDEF.NAME: stopTrig
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Identifier of the HW log record which will stop the Hw logging

FIELDDEF.NAME: startRecTyp
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Identifier of the HW log record which will turn on HW logging. HW logger is known to be stopped

FIELDDEF.NAME: stopRecTyp
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Identifier of the HW log record which will stop HW logging. HW logger is known to be stopped

FIELDDEF.NAME: startTrig
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Identifier of the HW log record which will turn on HW logging. HW logger is known to be stopped

FIELDDEF.NAME: stopTrig
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Identifier of the HW log record which will stop HW logging. HW logger is known to be stopped

FIELDDEF.NAME: EvtSet
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: HW logger event set id: 0=> Modem event group(EVG0) 1=> CLF event group(EVG1)

FIELDDEF.NAME: Mask
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Mask value to be assigned to the event set mentioned above

FIELDDEF.NAME: TimerId
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: For debug and verification of HW logger timer

FIELDDEF.NAME: evt0Mask
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Parameters for configuring HW and FW circular log buffering: for Hw logger Modem Event Mask

FIELDDEF.NAME: evt1Mask
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: CLF event mask: 0x8xxx_xxxx(xxx_xxxx will be applied), 0x0xxx_xxxx(xxx_xxxx will not be applied)

FIELDDEF.NAME: hwWatermark
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: HW logger watermark. Interrupt point. Default 4KB

FIELDDEF.NAME: fwWatermark
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: FW logger watermark. Dump event generation point. Default 3/4 of total log queue size

FIELDDEF.NAME: logChmask
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: FW log channel mask. Default enabled channel: Modem, Clf and setup

FIELDDEF.NAME: matchCtrlMode
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: As explained in 0x86 command type. But applies the changes after disabling HW logger and re-enables HW logger

FIELDDEF.NAME: startTrig
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: As explained in 0x88 command type. But applies the changes after disabling HW logger and re-enables HW logger

FIELDDEF.NAME: stopTrig
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: As explained in 0x88 command type. But applies the changes after disabling HW logger and re-enables HW logger

FIELDDEF.NAME: startStopTrig
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: As explained in 0x87 command type. But applies the changes after disabling HW logger and re-enables HW logger

FIELDDEF.NAME: evtMask0
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Parameters for configuring HW and FW circular log buffering: for Hw logger Modem Event Mask

FIELDDEF.NAME: evtMask1
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: CLF event mask: 0x8xxx_xxxx(xxx_xxxx will be applied), 0x0xxx_xxxx(xxx_xxxx will not be applied)

FIELDDEF.NAME: hwWatermark
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: HW logger watermark. Interrupt point. Default 4KB

FIELDDEF.NAME: logSizeInKb
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: HW log queue size; shall always be a multiple of 4 and less than equal to 28

FIELDDEF.NAME: startTrigger
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Identifier of the HW log record which will turn on HW logging. HW logger is known to be stopped

FIELDDEF.NAME: stopTrigger
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Identifier of the HW log record which will stop HW logging. HW logger is known to be stopped

FIELDDEF.NAME: mdmDbgBlockSel
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Select the modem block to be debugged

FIELDDEF.NAME: allowRollover
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Logger will wrap at the end of log memory

FIELDDEF.NAME: mdmLogErrTyp
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Parameter to select the modem error type; for retreival

FIELDDEF.NAME: mdmLogErrTyp
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Parameter to enable/disable modem local error counter

FIELDDEF.NAME: Length
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Byte length to be read out

STRUCTDEF.NAME: SETMEM_CMD
STRUCTDEF.COMMENT: Used to setup the Tag memory if using CE in NFCC

FIELDDEF.NAME: TagSize
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Total size of the tag memory. The first SETMEM_CMD initialize the size of memory block. If set to 0x0, reset the memory block.

STRUCTDEF.NAME: GETMEM_CMD
STRUCTDEF.COMMENT: Used to read out the Tag memory used for CE in NFCC

FIELDDEF.NAME: Addr
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Starting Address from which to read memory; will read out the maximum possible in a single NCI packet

STRUCTDEF.NAME: VSC_GET_CONFIG_CMD
STRUCTDEF.COMMENT: Proprietary Command to get VSC config items at a specific offset

FIELDDEF.NAME: NumEntries
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: To specify the number of set config entries

FIELDDEF.NAME: id0
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: The ID of the config entry

FIELDDEF.NAME: offset0
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: The byte offset to be read in the config entry

FIELDDEF.NAME: len0
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: The byte length to be read in the config entry

FIELDDEF.NAME: id1
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: The ID of the config entry

FIELDDEF.NAME: offset1
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: The byte offset to be read in the config entry

FIELDDEF.NAME: len1
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: The byte length to be read in the config entry

FIELDDEF.NAME: id2
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: The ID of the config entry

FIELDDEF.NAME: offset2
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: The byte offset to be read in the config entry

FIELDDEF.NAME: len2
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: The byte length to be read in the config entry

FIELDDEF.NAME: id3
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: The ID of the config entry

FIELDDEF.NAME: offset3
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: The byte offset to be read in the config entry

FIELDDEF.NAME: len3
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: The byte length to be read in the config entry

FIELDDEF.NAME: id4
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: The ID of the config entry

FIELDDEF.NAME: offset4
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: The byte offset to be read in the config entry

FIELDDEF.NAME: len4
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: The byte length to be read in the config entry

FIELDDEF.NAME: id5
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: The ID of the config entry

FIELDDEF.NAME: offset5
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: The byte offset to be read in the config entry

FIELDDEF.NAME: len5
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: The byte length to be read in the config entry

FIELDDEF.NAME: id6
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: The ID of the config entry

FIELDDEF.NAME: offset6
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: The byte offset to be read in the config entry

FIELDDEF.NAME: len6
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: The byte length to be read in the config entry

FIELDDEF.NAME: id7
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: The ID of the config entry

FIELDDEF.NAME: offset7
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: The byte offset to be read in the config entry

FIELDDEF.NAME: len7
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: The byte length to be read in the config entry

FIELDDEF.NAME: id8
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: The ID of the config entry

FIELDDEF.NAME: offset8
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: The byte offset to be read in the config entry

FIELDDEF.NAME: len8
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: The byte length to be read in the config entry

FIELDDEF.NAME: id9
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: The ID of the config entry

FIELDDEF.NAME: offset9
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: The byte offset to be read in the config entry

FIELDDEF.NAME: len9
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: The byte length to be read in the config entry

FIELDDEF.NAME: NumEntries
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: To specify the number of set config entries

FIELDDEF.NAME: id0
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: The ID of the config entry

FIELDDEF.NAME: offset0
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: The byte offset to be read in the config entry

FIELDDEF.NAME: len0
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: The byte length to be read in the config entry

FIELDDEF.NAME: id1
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: The ID of the config entry

FIELDDEF.NAME: offset1
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: The byte offset to be read in the config entry

FIELDDEF.NAME: len1
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: The byte length to be read in the config entry

FIELDDEF.NAME: id2
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: The ID of the config entry

FIELDDEF.NAME: offset2
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: The byte offset to be read in the config entry

FIELDDEF.NAME: len2
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: The byte length to be read in the config entry

FIELDDEF.NAME: id3
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: The ID of the config entry

FIELDDEF.NAME: offset3
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: The byte offset to be read in the config entry

FIELDDEF.NAME: len3
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: The byte length to be read in the config entry

FIELDDEF.NAME: id4
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: The ID of the config entry

FIELDDEF.NAME: offset4
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: The byte offset to be read in the config entry

FIELDDEF.NAME: len4
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: The byte length to be read in the config entry

FIELDDEF.NAME: id5
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: The ID of the config entry

FIELDDEF.NAME: offset5
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: The byte offset to be read in the config entry

FIELDDEF.NAME: len5
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: The byte length to be read in the config entry

FIELDDEF.NAME: id6
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: The ID of the config entry

FIELDDEF.NAME: offset6
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: The byte offset to be read in the config entry

FIELDDEF.NAME: len6
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: The byte length to be read in the config entry

FIELDDEF.NAME: id7
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: The ID of the config entry

FIELDDEF.NAME: offset7
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: The byte offset to be read in the config entry

FIELDDEF.NAME: len7
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: The byte length to be read in the config entry

FIELDDEF.NAME: id8
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: The ID of the config entry

FIELDDEF.NAME: offset8
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: The byte offset to be read in the config entry

FIELDDEF.NAME: len8
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: The byte length to be read in the config entry

FIELDDEF.NAME: id9
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: The ID of the config entry

FIELDDEF.NAME: offset9
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: The byte offset to be read in the config entry

FIELDDEF.NAME: len9
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: The byte length to be read in the config entry

STRUCTDEF.NAME: Super_Duper_Peek_Poke
STRUCTDEF.COMMENT: Command to directly write/read the NFCC memory addresses.

FIELDDEF.NAME: AccessType
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Register access type. 0x06: Single 32bit memory peek. 0x07: Multiple 32bit memory peek. 0x08: Single 32bit memory poke. 0x09: Multiple 8bit memory peek. 0x0A: Multiple 8bit memory poke.

FIELDDEF.NAME: Count
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Length of value. Depending on the access type, can be in 32bit or 8bit.

STRUCTDEF.NAME: Super_Duper_Peek_Poke_Resp
STRUCTDEF.COMMENT: Response to directly write/read the NFCC memory addresses.

FIELDDEF.NAME: AccessType
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Register access type. 0x06: Single 32bit memory peek. 0x07: Multiple 32bit memory peek. 0x08: Single 32bit memory poke. 0x09: Multiple 8bit memory peek. 0x0A: Multiple 8bit memory poke.

FIELDDEF.NAME: Count
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Length of value. Depending on the access type, can be in 32bit or 8bit.

STRUCTDEF.NAME: GET_BUILD_INFO_CMD
STRUCTDEF.COMMENT: Command to obtain the build info of the NFCC FW

FIELDDEF.NAME: FWMajor
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Major version of the NFCC FW release

FIELDDEF.NAME: FWMinor
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Minor version of the NFCC FW release

FIELDDEF.NAME: HWTs
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Corresponding ASIC or FPGA chip version number

STRUCTDEF.NAME: SCRIPT_DOWNLOAD_RSP
STRUCTDEF.COMMENT: Response to the script download command

STRUCTDEF.NAME: SET_HCI_NETWK_CMD
STRUCTDEF.COMMENT: Command to set the UICC info retrieved from hci_network_ntf from the device host

FIELDDEF.NAME: MSG_Length
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Message length, include the control byte and data.

FIELDDEF.NAME: isLast
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Assert if this is the last SET_HCI_NETWK_CMD for this Host ID. If there is only one SET_HCI_NETWK_CMD, both isLast and isFirst are TRUE.

FIELDDEF.NAME: isFirst
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Assert if this is the first SET_HCI_NETWK_CMD for this Host ID. All the previous info would be reset.

FIELDDEF.NAME: DATA
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: UICC info to be restored for this Host ID.

FIELDDEF.NAME: MSG_Length
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Message length, include the control byte and data.

FIELDDEF.NAME: isLast
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Assert if this is the last SET_HCI_NETWK_CMD for this Host ID. If there is only one HCI_NETWK_NTF, both isLast and isFirst are TRUE.

FIELDDEF.NAME: isFirst
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Assert if this is the first SET_HCI_NETWK_CMD for this Host ID.

FIELDDEF.NAME: DATA
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: UICC info to be restored for this Host ID.

FIELDDEF.NAME: DownloadPatchInCe4
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: CE3 Switch Off mode enable: Bit[0]-SO enable, Bit[1]-LPO off in SO, Bit[2]-FW Vbat Monitor enable, Bit[3]-Very Stubborn bit, Bit[7:5]-Primary Threshold

STRUCTDEF.NAME: FRAME_LOG_CMD
STRUCTDEF.COMMENT: Command to enable/disable Frame Logging from NFCC

FIELDDEF.NAME: nfcEnabled
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: If set to non zero value will enable RF frame logging

FIELDDEF.NAME: swpEnabled
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: If set to non zero will enable SWP frame logging

FIELDDEF.NAME: felicaSpiEnabled
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: If set to non zero will enable felica SPI frame logging

FIELDDEF.NAME: MSG_Length
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Message length, include the control byte and data.

FIELDDEF.NAME: isTx
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: 0 for RX and 1 for TX frame

FIELDDEF.NAME: TimeStamp
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: FW Time Stamp. It is a down Counter

FIELDDEF.NAME: Protocol
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: RF Protocol/Technology used during this Frame

STRUCTDEF.NAME: ISODEP_ERROR_INFO_NTF
STRUCTDEF.COMMENT: Notification to report ISO-DEP error. Set config item 0xB5 byte[0] to enable/disable this notification.

STRUCTDEF.NAME: VSC_SET_CONFIG_CMD
STRUCTDEF.COMMENT: Command to set VSC config items at a specific offset

FIELDDEF.NAME: MSG_Length
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Message length, include the control byte and data.

FIELDDEF.NAME: Data
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: UICC info to be restored for this Host ID.

STRUCTDEF.NAME: PRBS_SET_CMD
STRUCTDEF.COMMENT: Command to enable PRBS test mode

FIELDDEF.NAME: PRBSEn
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: If non zero will enable PRBS else will disable it

FIELDDEF.NAME: PRBSTech
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: RF Technology to be used for PRBS Testing

STRUCTDEF.NAME: DL_MINIDRIVER_CMD
STRUCTDEF.COMMENT: Command to perform Serial Flash read/write

STRUCTDEF.NAME: Update_UART_Baud_Rate_Cmd
STRUCTDEF.COMMENT: Command to dynamically change UART Baud rate

STRUCTDEF.NAME: SF_RW_CMD
STRUCTDEF.COMMENT: Command to perform Serial Flash read/write

FIELDDEF.NAME: SlaveSel
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Spiffy2 slave select between CS0(0x00) and CS1(0x01)

FIELDDEF.NAME: Offset
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Address on the SF for read/write

FIELDDEF.NAME: SlaveSel
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Spiffy2 slave select between CS0(0x00) and CS1(0x01)

FIELDDEF.NAME: Offset
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Address on the SF for read/write

STRUCTDEF.NAME: ANTENNA_SELF_TEST_CMD
STRUCTDEF.COMMENT: Command to perform Antenna self test

FIELDDEF.NAME: T1
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Low threshold for estimated average power

FIELDDEF.NAME: T2
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: High threshold for estimated average power

FIELDDEF.NAME: scalingFactor
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Number of power samples to average, power of two

FIELDDEF.NAME: cfg_txgain
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: SWK value loaded into Antenna tx gain config (ant_cfg_txgain) when ANTTEST_MODE_TXGAIN is enabled

FIELDDEF.NAME: cfg_rx
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: SWK value loaded Antenna rx config (ant_cfg_rx) when ANTTEST_MODE_RX is enabled

FIELDDEF.NAME: Value
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: SWK Value; Power value (I^2 + Q^2) if ANTTEST_MODE_REPORT_VALUE is enabled.

STRUCTDEF.NAME: NCIP_SET_NCI_MAX_PKT_SIZE_CMD
STRUCTDEF.COMMENT: Command to set limit NCI packet size on transport

FIELDDEF.NAME: maxSize
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: NFCC will limit the max Packet size to this value

STRUCTDEF.NAME: NCIP_SET_NCI_VERSION_CMD
STRUCTDEF.COMMENT: Command to switch between NCI 1.1 and NCI 2.0

FIELDDEF.NAME: NCI_Version
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: To use NCI 1.1, set to 0x11; To use NCI 2.0, set to 0x20. All the other value is invalid.

FIELDDEF.NAME: MInfoLen
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Byte length of the manufacture information appended

STRUCTDEF.NAME: NCI_ANTENNA_MSMT_CMD
STRUCTDEF.COMMENT: Command to measure antenna tune characteristics with NFCTestTool

FIELDDEF.NAME: paramSize
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: The size of the parameter array

FIELDDEF.NAME: paramData
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: The parameters vary based on the measurement mode

FIELDDEF.NAME: measSize
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: The size of the antenna data array

FIELDDEF.NAME: measData
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: The measurement data returned varies based on the measurement mode

STRUCTDEF.NAME: NFC_ECDSA256_VERIFY_HDR_CMD
STRUCTDEF.COMMENT: Command to handle the ECDSA verify data

STRUCTDEF.NAME: NFC_ECDSA256_PRE_G_DATA_CMD
STRUCTDEF.COMMENT: Command to handle the ECDSA verify data

STRUCTDEF.NAME: NFC_ECDSA256_PRE_Q_DATA_CMD
STRUCTDEF.COMMENT: Command to handle the ECDSA verify data

STRUCTDEF.NAME: NFC_ECDSA256_VERIFY_SIG_CMD
STRUCTDEF.COMMENT: Command to handle the data and signature to verify the ECDSA algorithm

FIELDDEF.NAME: MSG_Length
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Length of the signature verify message

STRUCTDEF.NAME: NFC_ECDSA256_VERIFY_RSP
STRUCTDEF.COMMENT: Response to the Secure patch download command

FIELDDEF.NAME: NumPkt
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Number of packets to tx and rx

FIELDDEF.NAME: AutoGen
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Indicate to firmware to auto generate packets 1-FW generate 0-DH generated

FIELDDEF.NAME: isTx
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: if 1 it is a Tx Frame ; if 0 it is a RX Frame

FIELDDEF.NAME: TimeStamp
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: FW Time Stamp. It is a down Counter

FIELDDEF.NAME: Tech
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: RF Technology used during this Frame

FIELDDEF.NAME: BitRate
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Bit Rate used during this Frame

FIELDDEF.NAME: Data
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Logged Frame Data. Only records first 24 bytes

FIELDDEF.NAME: IQIdx
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Index of last sample in circular buffer above

FIELDDEF.NAME: clfDelay
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: NFCC CLF Processing Time (us), - need add SWP Tx/Rx time

FIELDDEF.NAME: IblockCnt
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: PCD I-block count (pair), - to add 11 bytes per pair SWP transmission time

STRUCTDEF.NAME: Set_Sleepmode_Param
STRUCTDEF.COMMENT: Command to set sleep mode parameters

FIELDDEF.NAME: Sleep_Mode
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Set TRUE to enable sleep mode.

FIELDDEF.NAME: Combine_Sleep_Mode_And_LPM
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Set FALSE to ignore the NFC wake signal and we have a connection in power save mode.

STRUCTDEF.NAME: NCI_Get_Sleepmode_RSP
STRUCTDEF.COMMENT: Command to get sleep mode parameters

FIELDDEF.NAME: Sleep_Mode
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Set TRUE to enable sleep mode.

FIELDDEF.NAME: Combine_Sleep_Mode_And_LPM
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Set FALSE to ignore the NFC wake signal and we have a connection in power save mode.

STRUCTDEF.NAME: SWP_LOG_NTF
STRUCTDEF.COMMENT: NTF to report the SWP Frame logging

FIELDDEF.NAME: MSG_Length
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Byte length, include 1 control byte, 2 OFFSET bytes, and DATA.

STRUCTDEF.NAME: FELICA_LOG_NTF
STRUCTDEF.COMMENT: NTF to report the Felica SPI Frame logging

FIELDDEF.NAME: isTx
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: If 1 it is a Tx Frame; if 0 it is a RX Frame

FIELDDEF.NAME: TimeStamp
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: FW Time Stamp. It is a down Counter

STRUCTDEF.NAME: SET_EE_RDR_TOKEN_CMD
STRUCTDEF.COMMENT: Command to grant EE reader mode token

STRUCTDEF.NAME: SET_TINT_MODE_CMD
STRUCTDEF.COMMENT: Enable TINT HW debug mode in FW

FIELDDEF.NAME: enable
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: If non zero will enable TINT mode; else will disable it

STRUCTDEF.NAME: LPTD_NTF
STRUCTDEF.COMMENT: SWK LPTD False Detect threshold has been exceeded

STRUCTDEF.NAME: ACCESS_APP_CMD
STRUCTDEF.COMMENT: Historical message for NFCC information backup. Obsolete now

FIELDDEF.NAME: MSG_Length
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Byte length, include 1 control byte, 2 OFFSET bytes, and DATA.

STRUCTDEF.NAME: ACCESS_APP_NTF
STRUCTDEF.COMMENT: Historical message for NFCC information backup. Obsolete now

STRUCTDEF.NAME: SET_SECURE_MODE_CMD
STRUCTDEF.COMMENT: Command to enable/disable secure mode in NFCC

FIELDDEF.NAME: Enable_Secure_Mode
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: If non zero will enable secure mode in FW; else will disable it

FIELDDEF.NAME: Opcode
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: 0x00=Read data from NVM; 0x01= Write data to NVM

FIELDDEF.NAME: Offset
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Address on the NVM for read/write

FIELDDEF.NAME: Opcode
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: 0x00=Read data from NVM; 0x01= Write data to NVM

FIELDDEF.NAME: Offset
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Address on the NVM for read/write

STRUCTDEF.NAME: CFG_DATA_RW_CMD
STRUCTDEF.COMMENT: Command to read/write config data saved in NVM

FIELDDEF.NAME: MSG_Length
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Message length, include the control byte and data.

FIELDDEF.NAME: more
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Assert if this if more data to come

FIELDDEF.NAME: DATA
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: data read or to be written.

STRUCTDEF.NAME: CFG_DATA_RW_RSP
STRUCTDEF.COMMENT: Response to the config data read/write command

STRUCTDEF.NAME: CFG_DATA_RW_NTF
STRUCTDEF.COMMENT: Command to read/write config data saved in NVM

FIELDDEF.NAME: MSG_Length
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Message length, include the control byte and data.

FIELDDEF.NAME: more
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Assert if this if more data to come

FIELDDEF.NAME: DATA
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: data read or to be written.

STRUCTDEF.NAME: GET_CLF_REGISTERS_CMD
STRUCTDEF.COMMENT: Command to dump out the contents of all the CLF registers

STRUCTDEF.NAME: GET_CLF_REGISTERS_NTF
STRUCTDEF.COMMENT: The CLF register values dump notification

FIELDDEF.NAME: CLFLastNTF
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Value=0x0 indicates this is not the last segment; Value=0x1 indicates this is the last segment

FIELDDEF.NAME: CLFRegOffset
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Offset of the CLF registers w.r.t the base register address (nfc_ip_adr_base)

STRUCTDEF.NAME: NFC_RF_TEST_CMD
STRUCTDEF.COMMENT: Command for: (a) Toggle the RF field ON/OFF (b) As a reader, to Tx any frame for a given tech/protocol (c) To dump-out the CLF and other configuration registers

FIELDDEF.NAME: enable
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: 0x0 - the VSC is disbaled, 0x1 - the VSC is enabled

FIELDDEF.NAME: size
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: The size of the array to follow based on the opcode type

FIELDDEF.NAME: buffer
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: The array parameters vary based on the opcode type

STRUCTDEF.NAME: NFC_SPD_GET_VER_CMD
STRUCTDEF.COMMENT: Command to get the secure patch download version details

FIELDDEF.NAME: PatchCodeMaxSize
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Maximum size of the patch code

FIELDDEF.NAME: PatchCodeSize
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Full power mode - patch code size

FIELDDEF.NAME: PatchCodeHasBadCRC
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Bad CRC check for Full power mode patch code

STRUCTDEF.NAME: NFC_SPD_DOWNLOAD_HDR_CMD
STRUCTDEF.COMMENT: Command to handle the secure patch header download

FIELDDEF.NAME: MajorVer
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Major version of the NFCC FW

FIELDDEF.NAME: MinorVer
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Minor version of the NFCC FW

FIELDDEF.NAME: Hash
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Major version of the NFCC FW

FIELDDEF.NAME: Signature
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Minor version of the NFCC FW

STRUCTDEF.NAME: NFC_SPD_DOWNLOAD_INIT_CMD
STRUCTDEF.COMMENT: Command to handle the secure patch data download for INIT

FIELDDEF.NAME: Type
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Message Type - Secured Patch code for INIT

STRUCTDEF.NAME: NFC_SPD_DOWNLOAD_SRAM_CMD
STRUCTDEF.COMMENT: Command to handle the secure patch data download for SRAM

FIELDDEF.NAME: Type
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Message Type - Secured Patch code for SRAM

STRUCTDEF.NAME: NFC_SPD_DOWNLOAD_PATCHBRK_CMD
STRUCTDEF.COMMENT: Command to handle the secure patch data download for Patch Brk

FIELDDEF.NAME: Type
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Message Type - Secured Patch code for Patch Brk

STRUCTDEF.NAME: NFC_SPD_DOWNLOAD_PATCHRPL_CMD
STRUCTDEF.COMMENT: Command to handle the secure patch data download for Patch Rpl

FIELDDEF.NAME: Type
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Message Type - Secured Patch code for Patch Rpl

STRUCTDEF.NAME: NFC_SPD_DOWNLOAD_EXTRA_CMD
STRUCTDEF.COMMENT: Command to handle the secure patch data download for Extra

FIELDDEF.NAME: Type
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Message Type - Secured Patch code forExtra

STRUCTDEF.NAME: NFC_SPD_DOWNLOAD_SIG_CMD
STRUCTDEF.COMMENT: Command to handle the secure patch signature download

FIELDDEF.NAME: MSG_Length
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Length of the secured patch signature

STRUCTDEF.NAME: NFC_SPD_DOWNLOAD_SIGCHEK_DATA_CMD
STRUCTDEF.COMMENT: Command to handle the secure patch signature download check

FIELDDEF.NAME: MSG_Length
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Length of the signature check data message

FIELDDEF.NAME: Type
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Message Type - Secured Patch signature check

STRUCTDEF.NAME: NFC_SPD_DOWNLOAD_RSP
STRUCTDEF.COMMENT: Response to the Secure patch download command

STRUCTDEF.NAME: NFC_SPD_DOWNLOAD_NTF
STRUCTDEF.COMMENT: Notification to the Secure patch download command

STRUCTDEF.NAME: NFC_SPD_FORMAT_NVM_CMD
STRUCTDEF.COMMENT: Command to format the NVM contents

FIELDDEF.NAME: data
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Content is formatted with this data byte

STRUCTDEF.NAME: NFC_SWP_BIST_CMD
STRUCTDEF.COMMENT: SWP BIST TEST COMMAND which checks UICC during manufacture

FIELDDEF.NAME: TargetHandle
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Target handle for UICC0 or UICC1

FIELDDEF.NAME: TestType
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: eSE test type: check sum, read/write

FIELDDEF.NAME: Results
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: SWP BIST TEST results for four test types. 0x5A is pass

FIELDDEF.NAME: Polarity
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: I2C_REQ pin polarity, 1 is default, 0 is reverse

FIELDDEF.NAME: Type
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: 0 - read, 1 - write, 2 - init, 3 - wenable, 4 - wdisable, 5 - shutdown, 6 - write_dbgmajor, 7 - read_config, 8 - write_config, 9 - Disable Olympic test mode, 10 - Disable Mifare mode,11 - Read otp word

FIELDDEF.NAME: Type
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: 0 - read, 1 - write, 2 - init, 3 - wenable, 4 - wdisable, 5 - shutdown, 6 - write_dbgmajor, 7 - read_config, 8 - write_config, 9 - Disable Olympic test mode, 10 - Disable Mifare mode,11 - Read otp word

FIELDDEF.NAME: Offset
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Address on the UNIO for read/write

FIELDDEF.NAME: Offset
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Address on the UNIO for read/write

STRUCTDEF.NAME: SET_NFC_OFF_CMD
STRUCTDEF.COMMENT: Command to set NFC OFF Mode

FIELDDEF.NAME: setNfcOff
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: If set to one will set the NFC off

FIELDDEF.NAME: access_type
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: 1, one time; 2, poll periodically; 3, both; 4, reset data

STRUCTDEF.NAME: GET_IQ_DATA_NTF
STRUCTDEF.COMMENT: NTF to report the requested IQ data

STRUCTDEF.NAME: FELICA_SPI_RW_CMD
STRUCTDEF.COMMENT: Command to perform Felica SPI read/write

FIELDDEF.NAME: TypeRate
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Input parameter for Fix Pattern Trans

FIELDDEF.NAME: Pattern
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Input parameter for Fix Pattern Trans

FIELDDEF.NAME: NumOfTrans
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Input parameter for Fix Pattern Trans

FIELDDEF.NAME: Config
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Input parameter for RM Fix Pattern Trans

FIELDDEF.NAME: PreOffTime
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Input parameter for RM Fix Pattern Trans

FIELDDEF.NAME: PreOnTime
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Input parameter for RM Fix Pattern Trans

FIELDDEF.NAME: PostOnTime
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Input parameter for RM Fix Pattern Trans

FIELDDEF.NAME: PollingProfile
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Input parameter for RF Start Polling Cycle

FIELDDEF.NAME: LMTech
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Input parameter for Load modulation test

FIELDDEF.NAME: TxPwr
FIELDDEF.COMMENT: Input parameter for Load modulation test
